Description: Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery plastic female head, probably from a kernos; white slip; black applied eyes, dotted necklace, and headress; below, two narrow lines above band of vertical strokes; hollow inside with pre-firing hole at top.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 80)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 317, no. 1389, pl. 179, no. 1389)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2197) (phase 2)
